DOC.brief_summary: High fidelity simulation provide unique opportunity teach evaluation knowledge , clinical reasoning , decision making teamwork . We develop series novel cardiac base simulation review difficult learn objective cardiac anesthesiology rotation . We hypothesize resident complete rotation cardiac anesthesiology perceive simulation mentally challenge useful tool prepare subsequent clinical experience anesthesiology board . For first time , use NASA Task Load Index Scale evaluate Neuro Cognitive Workload Cardiac Anesthesia Based simulation scenario .Residents complete cardiac rotation least would assign task small group either group 2 group 3.The module consist 3 different scenario . The scenario include , wean patient cardio pulmonary bypass , management severe protamine drug reaction acute hypotension malfunction coronary graft simulate operating room real time . 1 . Setting Simulation Lab , almost similar real cardiac operating room would cardio-pulmonary bypass machine , transesophageal echocardiography image upon request , emergency medication various infusion pump , defibrillator , real time monitor include EKG , SpO2 , invasive arterial line , CVP , PAP , ETCO2 , operate room surgical equipment , anesthesia machine ventilator . 2 . Tasks Assigned resident 3 . Feed-back Teaching Session 4 . At end session resident encourage reflect upon perform learning gap perceive area felt need improve upon . 5 . Feedback session would follow interactive teach reinforce knowledge . 6 . Evaluation Hypothesis use NASA TLX Scale . Immediately follow Simulation base training , resident would give paper base NASA TLX scale ass neurocognitive workload
DOC.brief_title: Use High Fidelity Simulation Cardiac-specific Anesthesia Scenarios Resident Education Assessment
DOC.detailed_description: The Ohio State University CSEAC Scenarios Content expert : Sujatha Bhandary MD The Ohio State University CSEAC 1st Scenario Development Form Scenario Name : Weaning Cardiopulmonary Bypass Content expert : Sujatha Bhandary MD Date Development : 8/29/14 Targeted Audience : CA-2 , CA-3 anesthesia resident Simulation Platform : HPS Synopsis Scenario : The purpose scenario participant take thoughtful , systematic approach wean patient cardiopulmonary bypass ( CPB ) . Separation cardiopulmonary bypass task require attention multiple organ system , communication member patient care team ( i.e . surgeon , perfusionist ) , firm grasp cardiopulmonary physiology . A small randomized control study resident previously demonstrate simulation-based training wean CPB translate improved clinical performance OR . While task first overwhelming trainee , high fidelity simulation provide opportunity practice complex task safe environment . The scenario begin patient general anesthesia cardiopulmonary bypass . The surgeon complete uncomplicated triple vessel CABG 57 year old male 45 minute bypass time . When participant take case patient junctional bradycardia ( rate 40 ) MAP 50 mmHg , temperature 35 degree celcius , SpO2 100 % . The surgeon announce plan remove aortic cross clamp time resident call attending . The participant inform attend arrive need complete task . After removal cross clamp patient go ventricular fibrillation . The participant responsible recognize arrhythmia treat condition lidocaine defibrillation . After defibrillation patient go back junctional bradycardia participant need treat pacing . At point participant also need begin ventilate patient treat underlying hyperkalemia ( become evident upon obtain ABG ) . Failure treat hyperkalemia result refractory ventricular fibrillation . An echocardiogram ( request ) reveal normal appear heart good contractility . After pace patient , ventilate , treat underlie metabolic disturbance patient successfully wean CPB low dose epinephrine drip . At point scenario end . Learning Objectives : 1 . Describe condition necessary attempt wean patient CPB 2 . Demonstrate step involve wean patient CPB . 3 . Communicate effectively member patient care team ( i.e . perfusionist surgeon ) wean CPB . 4 . Recognize treat arrhythmia metabolic disturbance prior wean CPB . Scenario Intro ( read learner ) Your patient 57 year old male undergoing triple vessel CABG ( LIMA LAD , saphenous RCA , saphenous OM ) . In addition CAD patient history type 2 DM HLD . The surgeon complete last graft total bypass time 45 minute . The procedure uncomplicated point . The patient arterial line , 16 g IV , introducer PAC . The patient infusion receive isoflurance via bypass machine . The patient currently paralyze . There transesophageal echocardiogram available upon request . The surgeon place epicardial pacing wire . Your task wean patient CPB . Facilitator briefing/ Curricular information : Prior receive hand-off begin scenario participant hand sheet patient 's pre-op history physical already complete . All labs imaging provide . The resident opportunity ask additional question depart provider . The confederate room include cardiac surgeon perfusionist . Echocardiography available upon request arterial blood gas . The following infusion already in-line yet start : epinephrine , nitroprusside , insulin . Other cardiac drug ( lidocaine , amiodarone , nitroglycerine , norepinephrine , vasopressin ) drawn available . Epicardial wire come surgical field . These connect pace box provide upon request . Educational Learning Model Prerequisites : Completion cardiac anesthesiology rotation Didactics Needs : Powerpoint presentation , debrief room Learning Method : Experiential Debriefing Method : Guided reflection peer feedback . Didactic content . Preparation Supporting Files • Patient preoperative report • PowerPoint presentation Roles - Cardiac Surgeon - Perfusionist Setting - OR - Patient intubate , sedate , paralyzed , CPB Monitors Available Participant • Code Cart pacing/defibrillation pad • EKG monitoring • Five-lead electrocardiogram • Pulse-oximetry • Temperature probe - Capnography - Arterial catheter - Central venous catheter - Pulmonary artery catheter - Transesophageal Echocardiogram Other Equipment Required • Anesthesia machine pass check • Airway equipment cart include Macintosh 3 Miller 2 blade , endotracheal tube size 6 7 stylet empty 10 mL syringe • Two prepared 1000 mL intravenous fluid bag blood infusion line • Pharmacologic agent available upon request : propofol , etomidate , ketamine , succinylcholine , vecuronium , midazolam , fentanyl , atropine , ephedrine , phenylephrine , epinephrine ( syringe prepare 100 mL saline bag ) , norepinephrine ( syringe prepare 100 mL saline bag ) , vasopressin , neostigmine , glycopyrrolate , metoprolol , esmolol , • Epinephrine , Nitroprusside , Insulin drip connect manifold line patient 's CVC • Yankauer suction • Record keep material ( computer record paper ) ( IHIS ) - Foley catheter - Video echocardiogram normal heart ( transesophageal four chamber transgastric short axis ) - Alaris pump delivery IV anesthetic ( Epinephrine , Nitroprusside , Insulin ) Learner Information ( Information give learner scenario ) Scenario Introduction ( give learner 3 scenario ) : Your patient 57 year old male undergoing triple vessel CABG ( LIMA LAD , saphenous RCA , saphenous OM ) . In addition CAD patient history type 2 DM HLD . The surgeon complete last graft total bypass time 45 minute . The procedure uncomplicated point . The patient arterial line , 16 g IV , introducer PAC . The patient infusion receive isoflurance via bypass machine . The patient currently paralyze . There transesophageal echocardiogram available . The surgeon place epicardial pacing wire . Your task wean patient CPB . General Information ( SBAR ) : Name : Jerry Gergich Age : 57 Birth Date : 10/28/1957 Weight : 90 kg Height : 5'10 '' Vital Signs : HR 65 ( sinus ) , BP 122/80 , RR 14 , SpO2 98 % Patient History : History Present Illness : unstable angina x 1 month Allergies : NKDA Medications : carvedilol , glyburide , aspirin Past Medical / Surgical History : inguinal hernia repair ( uneventful GA ) Intake/outputs : n/a Symptoms : Events lead Illness : worsening chest pain Onset symptom : 1 month Provocation / provokes : exertion Severity pain : 5/10 Review Systems CNS : AAO x 3 , neurologic deficit Cardiovascular : chest discomfort exertion , syncope dyspnea Pulmonary : normal ; wheeze , cough Abdominal : within normal limit Physical Exam : Airway : MP 2 , good neck extention , normal TM distance , good oral opening Chest : RRR , murmur ; lung clear Abdominal : within normal limit Neuro : within normal limit Laboratory , Radiology , Other Relevant Studies : Labs : - Labs : Hct 39 , platelet 360 admission - Chemistry : within normal limit - Type Cross : negative antibody screen ; 4 unit available - PT , PTT , INR : within normal limit - LHC : 90 % stenosis LCA , RCA OM . - Echo : Normal LV RV size function ; LV EF 55 % - EKG : NSR , Inverted T wave lead II V5 . Simulation Sequence 1 . On Bypass Vital sign : HR BP SPO2 RR ETCO2 CVP PAP CO Temp 40 50 100 n/a n/a 5 5/3 n/a 35 EKG : junctional bradycardia Appearance/PE : intubate , sedate , paralyzed , CPB Operator detail : After receive hand-off surgeon announce soon remove aortic cross-clamp . Learner Objectives Interventions : The participant make sure he/she receive thorough hand-off clear understanding patient 's background surgical course . The resident call his/her attend physician preparation wean CPB . Transition Cue : Removal Cross Calmp Go state : Maintenance 2 . Ventricular Fibrillation Vital sign : HR BP SPO2 RR ETCO2 CVP PAP CO Temp n/a 40 100 % n/a n/a 4 5/2 n/a 35.3 EKG : Ventricular fibrillation Appearance/PE : anesthetize , paralyzed , CPB Operator detail : Surgeon continue operate without notice rhythm . If participant recognize rhythm within 30 second perfusionist announce give 100 mg lidocaine via bypass machine . Learner Objectives Interventions : The participant recognize arrhythmia direct surgeon administer shock patient . Transition Cue : Defibrillation Go state : Junctional Bradycardia 3 . Junctional Bradycardia Vital sign : HR BP SPO2 RR ETCO2 CVP PAP CO Temp 40 50 100 n/a n/a 4 5/2 n/a 35.3 EKG : junctional bradycardia Appearance/PE : Anesthetized , paralyze , CPB Operator detail : The surgeon ask participant begin ventilate patient . Learner Objectives Interventions : Participant ventilate patient adequate tidal volumes/rate . Ask pacer box begin pace patient . If participant ask , perfusionist simply bring participant pacing box ( pre-set 80 ; v-paced ) Transition Cue : Pacing Go state : Hyperkalemia 4 . Hyperkalemia Vital sign : HR BP SPO2 RR ETCO2 CVP PAP CO Temp 80 50 100 Vent 20 5 4/2 n/a 35.7 EKG : V-paced Appearance/PE : Anesthetized , paralyze , mechanically ventilate , CPB Operator detail : If participant already ask point , perfusionist bring him/her result ABG : ( pH 7.4 , paO2 350 , paCO2 34 , HCO3 22 , K+ 6 , Glu 250 , Ca++ 4 , Hct 24 ) . The surgeon ask come bypass . Learner Objectives Interventions : The participant treat underlie metabolic disturbance ( mainly hyperkalemia hyperglycemia ) allow surgeon proceed removal bypass . If insulin give patient progress state : `` wean '' . If insulin give patient go back state 2 : `` ventricular fibrillation '' . Transition Cue : Insulin Given Go state : Wean Off Transition Cue : Insulin Not Given Go state : Ventricular Fibrillation 4 . Wean Off Vital sign : HR BP SPO2 RR ETCO2 CVP PAP CO Temp 80 78/50 100 Vent 22 6 5/2 n/a 35.8 EKG : V-paced Appearance/PE : Anesthetized , paralyze , mechanically ventilate , CPB Operator detail : Surgeon ask drips patient . Learner Objectives Interventions : The participant look echocardiogram ( reveal normal heart ) . The participant provide inotropic support ( low dose epinephrine drip ) point BP increase approximately 110/60 30 second . The scenario end . The Ohio State University CSEAC 2nd Scenario Development Form Scenario Name : Protamine Reaction Content expert : Sujatha Bhandary MD Date Development : 8/29/14 Targeted Audience : CA-2 , CA-3 anesthesia resident Simulation Platform : HPS *Synopsis Scenario : The purpose scenario expose trainee severe type III protamine reaction wean cardiopulmonary bypass . Although severe reaction administration protamine ( severe pulmonary vasoconstriction , RV failure , systemic hypotesnsion ) rare , result catastrophic . High fidelity simulation provide opportunity trainee get exposure entity safe , control environment . The scenario follow debrief session allow participant reflect performance short didactic session proper administration protamine pathophysiology protamine reaction . The scenario begin completion previous scenario : `` Weaning Cardiopulmonary Bypass '' . As patient 57 year old male undergone uncomplicated triple vessel CABG 45 minute bypass time . The patient successfully wean CPB treatment hyperkalemia ( see prior scenario ) . This scenario begin either debrief previous scenario may begin without interruption . The surgeon start scenario ask participant administer protamine . At point patient hemodynamically stable ( V-paced 80 , BP 110/60 , PAP 30/15 , CO 5.2 ) . The patient start scenario epinephrine drip 0.02 mcg/kg/min . The participant inform patient give 30,000 unites heparin preparation go CPB . The last ACT 468 . The patient hemodynamic change response test dose protamine , participant continue administer appropriate dose . After 2 minute without change vitals patient begin undergo hemodynamic change consistent type III protamine reaction course 5 minute ( hypotesnsion , desaturation , decrease cardiac output , pulmonary hypertension ) . Upon recognize problem participant discontinue protamine infusion , call help , communicate surgeon , provide supportive care patient . An echocardiogram ( upon request ) demonstrate dilate RV . Intervening stop protamine administer vasopressor stabilize patient , however failure act result cardiovascular collapse necessitate go back CPB . Learning Objectives : 5.Demonstrate appropriate administration protamine follow cardiopulmonary bypass . 6.Recognize sign acute type III protamine reaction respond appropriately . 7.Describe different type protamine reaction , pathophysiology , risk factor develop . Scenario Intro ( read learner ) Your patient 57 year old male undergoing triple vessel CABG ( LIMA LAD , saphenous RCA , saphenous OM ) . In addition CAD patient history type 2 DM HLD . The procedure uncomplicated point . The patient arterial line , 16 g IV , introducer PAC . The patient currently paralyze . There transesophageal echocardiogram available upon request . The patient already successfully wean CPB hemodynamically stable low dose epinephrine drip . *Facilitator briefing/ Curricular information : Prior receive hand-off begin scenario participant hand sheet patient 's pre-op history physical already complete . All labs imaging provide . The resident opportunity ask additional question depart provider . The confederate room include cardiac surgeon perfusionist . Echocardiography available upon request arterial blood gas . The patient already epinephrine infusion 0.02 mcg/kg/min . Other cardiac drug ( lidocaine , amiodarone , nitroglycerine , norepinephrine , vasopressin ) drawn available . Epicardial wire come surgical field connect pace box set 80 ( V-paced ) . Educational Learning Model Prerequisites : Completion cardiac anesthesiology rotation Didactics Needs : Powerpoint presentation , debrief room Learning Method : Experiential Debriefing Method : Guided reflection peer feedback . Didactic content . Preparation Supporting Files - Patient preoperative report - PowerPoint presentation Roles - Cardiac Surgeon - Perfusionist Setting - OR - Patient intubate , sedate , paralyzed , CPB Monitors Available Participant • Code Cart pacing/defibrillation pad - EKG monitor - Five-lead electrocardiogram - Pulse-oximetry - Temperature probe - Capnography - Arterial catheter - Central venous catheter - Pulmonary artery catheter - Transesophageal Echocardiogram Other Equipment Required • Anesthesia machine pass check • Airway equipment cart include Macintosh 3 Miller 2 blade , endotracheal tube size 6 7 stylet empty 10 mL syringe - Two prepared 1000 mL intravenous fluid bag blood infusion line - Pharmacologic agent available upon request : propofol , etomidate , ketamine , succinylcholine , vecuronium , midazolam , fentanyl , atropine , ephedrine , phenylephrine , epinephrine ( syringe prepare 100 mL saline bag ) , norepinephrine ( syringe prepare 100 mL saline bag ) , vasopressin , neostigmine , glycopyrrolate , metoprolol , esmolol , - Epinephrine , Nitroprusside , Insulin drip connect manifold line patient 's CVC - Yankauer suction - Record keep material ( compurecord paper ) ( IHIS ) - Foley catheter - Video echocardiogram normal heart ( transesophageal four chamber transgastric short axis ) - Alaris pump delivery IV anesthetic ( Epinephrine , Nitroprusside , Insulin ) - Pacing Box Learner Information ( Information give learner scenario ) 1 . Initial Baseline Vital sign : HR BP SPO2 RR ETCO2 CVP PAP CO Temp 80 110/60 100 Vent ( 14 ) 30 12 30/15 5.4 36 EKG : V-paced Appearance/PE : intubate , sedate , paralyzed , vent Operator detail : Epi infusion run 0.02 mcg/kg/min patient 's central line . This scenario state take directly final state prior scenario ( `` wean CPB '' ) . The surgeon ask protamine give . If participant asks perfusionist inform him/her total heparin dose 30,000 unit last ACT 468 . The test dose negative ( change vital sign ) . ABG ( request ) : pH 7.34 , PaO2 350 , PaCO2 35 , HCO3 23 , K+ 4.4 , Ca++ 4 , Glu 180 , Hct 23 ) Learner Objectives Interventions : Calculation proper reversal dose protamine . Administration test dose protamine slow administration full reversal dose careful attention potential hemodynamic change . Transition Cue : Administration Protamine Go state : Protamine Reaction 2 . Protamine Reaction Vital sign : HR BP SPO2 RR ETCO2 CVP PAP CO Temp 80 70/35 92 % Vent ( 14 ) 20 28 60/45 36 EKG : V-pace Appearance/PE : anesthetize , paralyzed , vent Operator detail : Changes vital sign occur slowly ( 5 minute ) . Surgeon continue operate without notice change vital sign . An Echo ( request ) show dilate RV . Stopping infusion administration vasopressor result stabilization . Failure stop infusion lead deterioration . Learner Objectives Interventions : Discontinue protamine infusion . Communicate surgeon . Call help . Provide supportive care patient ( vasopressor ) . Transition Cue : Stop Infusion Go state : Stabilization Transition Cue : Failure Stop Infusion Go state : Severe Reaction 3 . Stabilization Vital sign : HR BP SPO2 RR ETCO2 CVP PAP CO Temp 80 95/57 95 Vent ( 14 ) 30 16 40/20 36 EKG : V-paced Appearance/PE : intubate , sedate , paralyzed , vent Operator detail : Vitals stabilize current state 2 minute follow discontinuation protamine administration vasopressor . Surgeon ask provider restart protamine . After discussion surgeon scenario end . Learner Objectives Interventions : Discuss surgeon option reversal heparin . 4 . Severe Reaction Vital sign : HR BP SPO2 RR ETCO2 CVP PAP CO Temp 80 45/20 89 Vent ( 14 ) 15 23 70/44 36 EKG : V-paced Appearance/PE : intubate , sedate , paralyzed , vent Operator detail : Failure stop infusion result worsen patient 's condition current state . Surgeon become aware hemodynamic change insist go emergently back CPB . The scenario end . The Ohio State University CSEAC 3rd Scenario Development Form Scenario Name : Coronary Air After Bypass Grafting Content expert : Sujatha Bhandary MD Date Development : 8/29/14 Targeted Audience : CA-2 , CA-3 anesthesia resident Simulation Platform : HPS Synopsis Scenario : The purpose scenario participant take thoughtful , systematic approach sudden onset ST change hypotension follow completion coronary artery bypass graft ( CABG ) surgery . Specifically scenario deal intracoronary air , unrecognized fatal . Residual air report present much 12 % patient undergoing CABG surgery . * This simulation give resident chance treat condition safe , constructive environment comfortable diagnose rare potentially devastating condition . The simulation intend rely resident ' knowledge cardiac physiology , basic echocardiography interpretation . The scenario start follow completion previous scenario ( Protamine Reaction ) time patient successfully weaned bypass chest close . Immediately begin scenario surgeon leave room . At time fellow ( confederate ) begin suture skin . Shortly thereafter patient ST elevation inferior EKG lead . The fellow ask echocardiogram look okay . A mid-esophageal four-chamber view patient 's heart demonstrate air bubble leave ventricle . A trans-gastric short axis view heart ( request ) show inferior wall heart akinetic . The patient become hypotensive decreased cardiac index . The resident simultaneously form differential diagnosis treat symptom communicate surgeon his/her finding . Ultimately resident request surgeon reopen patient 's chest purge intra-cardiac air . Failing result patient go cardiogenic shock ventricular fibrillation . Learning Objectives : 8 . Form differential post CABG hypotension EKG change . 9 . Diagnose intra-cardiac air regional wall motion abnormality echocardiogram . 10 . Effectively treat cardiogenic shock pharmacologic agent . 11 . Communicate surgeon regard need surgical intervention . Scenario Intro ( read learner ) Your patient 57 year old male undergoing triple vessel CABG ( LIMA LAD , saphenous RCA , saphenous OM ) . In addition CAD patient history type 2 DM HLD . The surgeon complete grafts total bypass time 45 minute . The patient wean cardiac bypass successfully reverse protamine . The chest close . The procedure uncomplicated point . The patient arterial line , 16 g IV , introducer PAC . The patient low dose epinephrine infusion ( .0.02 mcg/kg/min ) . The patient currently paralyze . There transesophageal echocardiogram available upon request . The surgeon place epicardial pacing wire . You responsible transition patient cardiac ICU . Facilitator briefing/ Curricular information : Prior receive hand-off begin scenario participant hand sheet patient 's pre-op history physical already complete . All labs imaging provide . The resident opportunity ask additional question depart provider . The confederate room include cardiac surgeon perfusionist . Echocardiography available upon request arterial blood gas . The patient low dose epinephrine infusion ( 0.02 mcg/kg/min ) . Other cardiac drug ( lidocaine , amiodarone , nitroglycerine , norepinephrine , vasopressin ) drawn available . Epicardial wire come surgical field . These connect pace box provide upon request . Educational Learning Model Prerequisites : Completion cardiac anesthesiology rotation Didactics Needs : Powerpoint presentation , debrief room Learning Method : Experiential Debriefing Method : Guided reflection peer feedback . Didactic content . Preparation Supporting Files - Patient preoperative report - PowerPoint presentation Roles - Cardiac Surgeon - Perfusionist Setting - OR - Patient intubate , sedate , paralyzed , CPB Monitors Available Participant • Code Cart pacing/defibrillation pad • EKG monitoring • Five-lead electrocardiogram • Pulse-oximetry • Temperature probe • Capnography • Arterial catheter • Central venous catheter - Pulmonary artery catheter - Transesophageal Echocardiogram Other Equipment Required • Anesthesia machine pass check • Airway equipment cart include Macintosh 3 Miller 2 blade , endotracheal tube size 6 7 stylet empty 10 mL syringe • Two prepared 1000 mL intravenous fluid bag blood infusion line • Pharmacologic agent available upon request : propofol , etomidate , ketamine , succinylcholine , vecuronium , midazolam , fentanyl , atropine , ephedrine , phenylephrine , epinephrine ( syringe prepare 100 mL saline bag ) , norepinephrine ( syringe prepare 100 mL saline bag ) , vasopressin , neostigmine , glycopyrrolate , metoprolol , esmolol , • Epinephrine , Nitroprusside , Insulin drip connect manifold line patient 's CVC • Yankauer suction • Record keep material ( compurecord paper ) ( IHIS ) - Foley catheter - Video echocardiogram 2 view ( transesophageal four chamber intracardiac air LV transgastric short axis akinetic inferior wall ) - Alaris pump delivery IV anesthetic ( Epinephrine , Nitroprusside , Insulin *Learner Information ( Information give learner scenario ) Simulation Sequence 1 . Chest Closed Vital sign : HR BP SPO2 RR ETCO2 CVP PAP CO Temp 70 110/60 100 14 ( vent ) 35 12 30/15 5 36.3 EKG : normal sinus rhythm Appearance/PE : intubate , sedate , paralyze ; chest close Operator detail : The surgeon finish close chest time he/she give sign leave room . Learner Objectives Interventions : The participant make sure he/she receive thorough hand-off clear understanding patient 's background surgical course . Transition Cue : Surgeon leave room Go state : ST elevation 2 . ST Changes Vital sign : HR BP SPO2 RR ETCO2 CVP PAP CO Temp 70 110/60 100 % 14 ( vent ) 35 12 30/15 5 36.3 EKG : Normal sinus rhythm ; ST depression AVF , II , III Appearance/PE : intubate , sedate , paralyze ; chest close Operator detail : Fellow begin suture skin ask participant cardiac index . At point patient experience ST depression inferior lead . Learner Objectives Interventions : The participant recognize EKG change look echocardiogram clinical correlation . He/She communicate surgical team . Transition Cue : Learner look Echocardiogram Go state : ST Elevation 3 . ST Elevation Vital sign : HR BP SPO2 RR ETCO2 CVP PAP CO Temp 70 85/50 100 14 ( vent ) 27 10 40/25 1.5 36.3 EKG : normal sinus rhythm ; ST elevation AVF , II , III Appearance/PE : Intubated , sedate , paralyze ; chest close Operator detail : TEE four chamber view demonstrate air bubble LV . Trans-gastric short axis show akinetic inferior wall . Patient get hypotensive 2 minute , respond IV epinephrine . The participant communicate surgeon regard need re-opening point scenario end . If he/she communicate surgical team patient decompensate go VFib . Transition Cue : Failure communicate surgeon Go state : VFib 4 . VFib Vital sign : HR BP SPO2 RR ETCO2 CVP PAP CO Temp n/a - - 14 ( vent ) 0 0 0 0 36.3 EKG : V-fib Appearance/PE : Intubated , sedate , paralyze ; chest close Operator detail : Failure communicate team regard intracardiac air need re-open result worsen cardiogenic shock develop ventricular fibrillation . Surgeon re-enter room ask happen . Learner Objectives Interventions : Recognize ventricular fibrillation begin ACLS ( epinephrine/defibrillation ) . Regonize intracoronary air ca
DOC.criteria: Resident physician complete least one month cardiac rotation included.This high fidelity simulation lab course offerred every resident meet criteria.This part educational activity.At begin course give option participate survey.If wish participate survey affect education.Participitaion survey purely voluntary . Resident physician wish participate fill survey able fill survey .
DOC.keyword: cardiac anesthesia simulation , NASA task load index
